Record_string.unknown_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

paymentRail.description: The payment rail of the withdrawal.

accountDetail.description: The crypto or bank account detail of the withdrawal.

failureReason.description: The failure reason of the withdrawal in case of failure.

externalAccountId.description: The id of the external (bank or crypto) account to withdraw to.

paymentRail.description:
Optional for bank withdrawals: The payment rail to use for the withdrawal.
If not provided, the payment rail will be inferred from the external account.
e.g. if the external account is of type `us_ach`, the payment rail will be `ach`.
if the external account is of type `us_wire`, the payment rail will be `wire`.
if the external account is of type `iban`, the payment rail will be `sepa`.
But you can also use wire for an us_ach account or ach for a us_wire account.
And also you specify swift for an iban account if you wish.

Paginated_WithdrawalResponse_.description: Represents a paginated collection of items.

items.description: The items in the current page.

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the current page.

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the current page.

before.description: Gets results before the specified cursor.

after.description: Gets results after the specified cursor.

perPage.description: The maximum number of items to fetch.

UserStatus.description: Whether the user is active or inactive in Airtm

id.description: Unique Airtm identifier of the user associated with the email.

primaryEmail.description:
Indicates if the queried email corresponds to the user's primary email

> [!tip]
> Airtm allows accounts to register secondary emails

firstName.description: The user's first name as registered in Airtm

lastName.description: The user's last name as registered in Airtm

country.description: The ISO alpha-3 code for the country where the user's ID was issued

isVerified.description: Indicates whether the user is verified

ReportStatus.description:
The current status of the report

- `PENDING`: The report is pending generation.
- `IN_PROGRESS`: The report is currently being generated.
- `COMPLETED`: The report has been generated and is ready for download.
- `FAILED`: The report generation failed.

status.description: The current status of the report

year.description: The year of the report to generate

month.description: The month of the report to generate

type.description: The type of the report to generate

Paginated_Report_.description: Represents a paginated collection of items.

items.description: The items in the current page.

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the current page.

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the current page.

before.description: Gets results before the specified cursor.

after.description: Gets results after the specified cursor.

Pick_PaginationParams.Exclude_keyofPagin.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

before.description: Gets results before the specified cursor.

after.description: Gets results after the specified cursor.

type.description: The type of report to filter by

perPage.description: The maximum number of items to fetch.

url.description: The URL of the activity report file.

PayoutStatus.description:
The current status of the payout.

- `CREATED`: The payout instruction has been registered and is awaiting you to call the commit endpoint.
- `COMMITTED`: The payout was committed and is in the process of being executed.
- `PENDING`: Funds have been placed in escrow and waiting for the recipient to take the following action to complete the payout
  1. If a new user, create an Airtm account.
  2. If a user receiving an amount taking them over the $1,000 inflow threshold requiring KYC.
  3. If a US user, complete KYC and configure payment method.
- `COMPLETED`: The payout has been completed successfully, funds have been credited to the customer's account.
- `CANCELED`: Payout has been canceled and funds have been returned to your account.
- `FAILED`: The payout has failed and funds have been returned to your account.
- `ERROR`: An unexpected error occurred. Please contact [enterprise@airtm.com](mailto:enterprise@airtm.com).

KycInformation.description:
Represents the user's KYC information for a payout.

> [!TIP]
> Only available in `payout.completed` webhook and only if ID verification is enabled in your account.
> If you want access to this information, please contact [enterprise@airtm.io](mailto:enterprise@airtm.io)
Represents the user's KYC information for a payout.

> [!TIP]
> Only available in `payout.completed` webhook and only if ID verification is enabled in your account.
> If you want access to this information, please contact [enterprise@airtm.io](mailto:enterprise@airtm.io)

id.description: This is the unique identifier for the payout.

bulkPayoutId.description: The identifier of the bulk payout that created this payout.

hash.description: Unique hash for the payout operation within the Airtm system.

code.description: A unique code used to identify the payout.

airtmUserId.description: This is the unique identifier for the AirTM user associated with this payout.

airtmUserEmail.description: This is the email of the Airtm user associated with this payout.

requireIdVerified.description: Whether the recipient must be ID-verified to receive the funds

notes.description: An arbitrary string describing the payment. This information is displayed to the recipient.

internalNote.description: The description of the payout; visible to internal users

grossAmount.description: amount originally intended for the payout

amount.description: amount to be deducted from the enterprise account (grossAmount - enterpriseFee)

netAmount.description: amount received by the user (grossAmount - enterpriseFee - airtmFee)

airtmFee.description: The airtm fee applied to the payout

enterpriseFee.description: The enterprise fee applied to the payout

reasonCode.description: Machine-friendly code relating to the reason why the payout has the current status

reasonDescription.description: Human-readable message describing the reason why the payout has the current status

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the payout was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update made to the payout.

airtmUserEmail.description: The recipient's email address that is associated with their Airtm account

commit.description:
Immediately commit the payout.

If `true`, the payout will be committed immediately after creation. Use this if you want to
create a payout in just one API call instead of a two-step process outlined in the Create / Commit
process.

code.description:
A unique code used to identify the payout.
Populate this value with the identifier on your system.

> [!important]
> It must be unique across all existing payouts.

enterpriseFee.description: The enterprise fee to apply to the payout

notes.description:
An arbitrary string describing the payment.
This information is displayed to the recipient.
It's recommended that the string summarizes the purpose of the payment.

internalNote.description: The description of the payout; visible to internal users

requireIdVerified.description: Set this to true to require that the recipient is ID-verified

Paginated_PayoutResponse_.description: Represents a paginated collection of items.

items.description: The items in the current page.

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the current page.

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the current page.

before.description: Gets results before the specified cursor.

after.description: Gets results after the specified cursor.

perPage.description: The maximum number of items to fetch.

PayinStatus.description:
The current status of the payin

- `CREATED`: The payin has been created but not yet confirmed.
- `CONFIRMED`: The payin has been confirmed and is ready for processing.
- `CANCELED`: The payin has been canceled by the user or system.
- `PROCESSING`: The payin is currently being processed.
- `FAILED`: The payin has failed due to an error.
- `BRIDGE_FAILED`: The payin has failed due to an error in Bridge.
- `BRIDGE_CANCELED`: The payin has been canceled due to an error in Bridge.

updatedAt.description: Date when the event was last updated.

createdAt.description: Date when the event was created.

fboBalance.description: Total balance available in the FBO account.

pendingBalance.description: Balance that is committed in pending payouts.

operationType.description:
Type of the operation associated with the event.

It could be either 'PAYOUT' or 'PAYIN'.

operationId.description: Unique identifier for the operation associated with the event.

userId.description: Unique identifier for the user associated with the event.

OperationEvent.description: An operation event is generated when a payin or payout transitions status.

PayinItem.description: An item within a payin transaction

description.description: An arbitrary string describing the individual item.

amount.description: The price in USD of the individual item.

quantity.description:
The number of items being purchased.
This will be multiplied with the 'amount' value to calculate the total.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item

payinId.description: The unique identifier for the payin.

PayinResponse.description:
A payin is a transaction that transfers funds from a user's Airtm account to an enterprise's account.
Normally, the payin represents a purchase made by a user.

id.description: The unique identifier for the payin.

code.description:
An arbitrary string of the partner’s choosing. Used to identify and correlate Airtm purchases with partner records.

> [!important]
> Must be a unique.

hash.description: Unique hash for the payin operation within the Airtm system.

amount.description: Amount in USD that was transacted in the operation.

netAmount.description: Amount in USD to be received by the enterprise

airtmFee.description: Amount to be collected by Airtm as fee

description.description:
A text string describing the purchase.

> [!tip]
> This text is displayed to the user when they are confirming the transaction.

items.description: An array of the items being purchased/bought.

airtmUserId.description: The unique identifier for the AirTM user associated with this payin.

airtmUserEmail.description: The email of the Airtm user associated with this payin.

failureReason.description: If the payin failed to complete, this field will describe why it failed.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the payin was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update made to the payin.

confirmationUri.description: A URL to redirect the user to when they confirm the transaction.

cancelUri.description: A URL to redirect the user to when they cancel the transaction.

description.description: An arbitrary string describing the individual item.

amount.description: The price in USD of the individual item.

quantity.description:
The number of items being purchased.
This will be multiplied with the 'amount' value to calculate the total.

code.description:
An arbitrary string of the partner’s choosing. Used to identify and correlate Airtm purchases with partner records.

> [!important]
> Must be unique.

amount.description:
The total amount in USD of the purchase.

> [!important]
> This value must correctly correspond to the sum of the amounts associated with each purchase item.

description.description: A text string describing the purchase. This text is displayed to the user when they are confirming the transaction.

items.description: An array of the items being purchased/bought.

confirmationUri.description: A URL to redirect the user to when they confirm the transaction.

cancelUri.description: A URL to redirect the user to when they cancel the transaction.

Paginated_PayinResponse_.description: Represents a paginated collection of items.

items.description: The items in the current page.

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the current page.

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the current page.

before.description: Gets results before the specified cursor.

after.description: Gets results after the specified cursor.

perPage.description: The maximum number of items to fetch.

cancelPendingPayoutsAfterDays.description: Number of days after which pending payouts will be automatically canceled.

payoutRequireIdVerification.description:
Indicates whether the enterprise can require ID verification for payouts.

To enable it, reach out to your account manager.

pending.description: Amount committed to pending payouts in the account.

id.description: The UUID of the crypto external account.

createdAt.description: The date and time the crypto external account was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time the crypto external account was updated.

type.description: The type of crypto wallet to create.

currency.description: The currency of the crypto wallet. Only USDC is supported.

alias.description: The alias of the crypto wallet.

address.description: The address of the crypto wallet.

memo.description: The memo of the crypto wallet.

Paginated_CryptoExternalAccountResponse_.description: Represents a paginated collection of items.

id.description: The id of the bank external account.

accountType.description: The type of account to create.

accountOwnerName.description: The name of the account owner.

usAccount.description: The account details for US ACH or US Wire accounts.

iban.description: The IBAN details for IBAN accounts.

swift.description:
Optional: The SWIFT details for IBAN account.
When accountType is 'iban', the swift field is optional, meaning you can include it to provide additional SWIFT-specific information (like business context, purpose of funds, etc.), but it's not required for basic IBAN account creation.

createdAt.description: The date and time the bank external account was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time the bank external account was updated.

accountType.description: The type of account to create.

accountOwnerName.description: The name of the account owner.

usAccount.description: The account details for US ACH or US Wire accounts.

iban.description: The IBAN details for IBAN accounts.

swift.description:
Optional: The SWIFT details for IBAN account.
When accountType is 'iban', the swift field is optional, meaning you can include it to provide additional SWIFT-specific information (like business context, purpose of funds, etc.), but it's not required for basic IBAN account creation.

PaginationParams.description: Pagination parameters for fetching paginated data.

before.description: Gets results before the specified cursor.

after.description: Gets results after the specified cursor.

perPage.description: The maximum number of items to fetch.

BulkPayoutStatus.description:
The current status of the bulk payout

- `PENDING`: The bulk payout was received, but it has yet to be started
- `IN_PROGRESS`: Our system is currently processing all the individual payouts contained in this bulk payout.
- `COMPLETED`: This doesn't mean all payouts were completed successfully, it may have guest or failed items. It means only that the processing, validations and creation of operations related to that task is completed.
- `REJECTED`: The enterprise rejected the bulk payout
- `UNCOMPLETED`: Reserved for future use

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of the last update made to the payout.

executionDate.description: Timestamp of when the payout was executed.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the payout was created.

paidAmount.description: Aggregated amount of all individual payouts in this bulk that were paid

totalAmount.description: Aggregated amount of all individual payouts in this bulk

total.description: Number of individual payouts in this bulk

originalFileName.description: The name of the file if the bulk payout was created uploading a CSV

enterpriseUserId.description: Unique identifier of the enterprise who created this bulk payout

airtmUserEmail.description: The recipient's email address that is associated with their Airtm account

code.description:
A unique code used to identify the payout.
Populate this value with the identifier on your system.

> [!important]
> It must be unique across all existing payouts.

enterpriseFee.description: The enterprise fee to apply to the payout

notes.description:
An arbitrary string describing the payment.
This information is displayed to the recipient.
It's recommended that the string summarizes the purpose of the payment.

internalNote.description: The description of the payout; visible to internal users

requireIdVerified.description: Set this to true to require that the recipient is ID-verified

Omit_CreatePayoutRequest.commit_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

payouts.description: A list of individual payouts to process in bulk

info.title: Airtm Enterprise API V2
info.description:
# Introduction

The Airtm Enterprise API enables organizations to send and receive payments globally through a simple REST API.

## What You Can Do

- **Send Payouts**: Pay employees, contractors, and partners in [190+ countries](https://help.airtm.com/en/support/solutions/articles/47001177565-where-are-airtm-s-products-and-services-available-)
- **Collect Payments**: Accept payments from users worldwide
- **Generate Reports**: Download transaction data and audit reports
- **Process in Bulk**: Handle thousands of payments efficiently

## Getting Started

### 1. Get API Credentials

[Sign up](https://airtm-product.typeform.com/to/ggXbsJpl?typeform-source=api-docs) for an Enterprise account

### 2. Generate API Keys

Create keys in your [account settings](https://enterprise.airtm.com/settings)

### 3. Test Your Setup

Make your first API call to verify connectivity

```bash
curl "https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/v2/me" \
  -u "your_api_key:your_secret_key"
```

## Environments

### Sandbox

Testing with fake money

URL: `https://api.stg.enterprise.airtm.com`

### Production

Live transactions

URL: `https://api.enterprise.airtm.com`

## Rate Limits

- **10 requests per second** per API key
- HTTP 429 response when exceeded
- Contact support for higher limits

## Security

- Use HTTPS for all requests
- Store credentials securely (never in client code)
- Separate sandbox and production keys

## Need Help?

- **Technical Support**: [enterprise@airtm.com](mailto:enterprise@airtm.com)
- **API Updates**: Follow our [Changelog](#description/changelog)
- **Error Reference**: Check [Reason Codes](#description/reason-codes)


---

# Authentication

The Airtm Enterprise API uses HTTP Basic Authentication for all requests.

## How It Works

Every API call must include an `Authorization` header with your API credentials:

```text
Authorization: Basic <base64-encoded-credentials>
```

## Getting Your API Keys

1. Log into your [dashboard](https://enterprise.airtm.com)
2. Go to **Settings** → **API Keys**
3. Click **Generate New API Key**
4. Save both the API Key and Secret Key securely

> **⚠️ Important**: Your Secret Key is only shown once. Store it immediately.

## Setting Up Authentication

### Step 1: Combine Your Credentials

Format: `api_key:secret_key`

Example: `your_api_key:your_secret_key`

### Step 2: Base64 Encode

Use any base64 encoder or command line:

```bash
echo -n "your_api_key:your_secret_key" | base64
```

### Step 3: Add to Request Header

```text
Authorization: Basic <base64_encoded_credentials>
```

## Code Examples

### cURL

```bash
curl -X GET "https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/v2/me" \
  -u "your_api_key:your_secret_key"
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
const response = await fetch('https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/v2/me', {
  headers: {
    Authorization: 'Basic ' + btoa('your_api_key:your_secret_key'),
  },
});
```

### Python

```python
import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

response = requests.get(
    'https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/v2/me',
    auth=HTTPBasicAuth('your_api_key', 'your_secret_key')
)
```

## Security Best Practices

- **Store securely**: Use environment variables
- **Server-side only**: Never expose keys in client code
- **Rotate regularly**: Update keys every 90 days

## Common Errors

### 401 Unauthorized

- Check your API key and secret
- Verify base64 encoding is correct
- Ensure you're using the right environment keys

### 403 Forbidden

- Contact support to verify account permissions
- Check if your account is fully activated

## Need Help?

For authentication issues:

- **Email**: [enterprise@airtm.com](mailto:enterprise@airtm.com)
- **Keys not working?** Check your [Enterprise Dashboard](https://enterprise.airtm.com/settings)


---

# Connecting

This guide covers environments, rate limits, and webhook configuration for the Airtm Enterprise API.

## API Environments

| Environment | Base URL                               |
| ----------- | -------------------------------------- |
| Sandbox     | `https://api.stg.enterprise.airtm.com` |
| Production  | `https://api.enterprise.airtm.com`     |

### Environment Setup

Use different API keys for each environment:

- **Sandbox**: Use your sandbox API keys for testing
- **Production**: Use your production API keys for live transactions

> [!IMPORTANT]
> Never mix environments. Use sandbox keys only in sandbox, production keys only in production.

## Rate Limits

- **Limit**: 10 requests per second per API key
- **Response**: HTTP 429 when exceeded
- **Applies to**: All endpoints in both environments

### Handling Rate Limits

Implement exponential backoff when you receive 429 responses:

```javascript
async function makeApiCall(url, options, retries = 3) {
  try {
    const response = await fetch(url, options);

    if (response.status === 429 && retries > 0) {
      const delay = Math.pow(2, 4 - retries) * 1000;
      await new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, delay));
      return makeApiCall(url, options, retries - 1);
    }

    return response;
  } catch (error) {
    throw error;
  }
}
```

## IP Addresses

**Sandbox:**

```text
54.192.137.90
54.192.137.12
54.192.137.42
54.192.137.126
2600:9000:2062:1400:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
2600:9000:2062:8e00:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
2600:9000:2062:b800:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
2600:9000:2062:7e00:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
2600:9000:2062:7c00:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
2600:9000:2062:6800:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
2600:9000:2062:f600:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
2600:9000:2062:3400:1f:5ce8:1ac0:93a1
```

**Production:**

```text
13.224.222.5
13.224.222.93
13.224.222.70
13.224.222.79
2600:9000:21a8:1000:15:e711:f040:93a1
2600:9000:21a8:d000:15:e711:f040:93a1
2600:9000:21a8:3200:15:e711:f040:93a1
2600:9000:21a8:e000:15:e711:f040:93a1
2600:9000:21a8:de00:15:e711:f040:93a1
2600:9000:21a8:fc00:15:e711:f040:93a1
2600:9000:21a8:3c00:15:e711:f040:93a1
2600:9000:21a8:7200:15:e711:f040:93a1
```


---

# Reason Codes

When API requests fail, you'll receive specific reason codes to help identify and resolve issues quickly.

## Error Categories

### Authentication & Authorization

- **415006**: No API keys configured - Set up API keys in settings
- **415024**: Maximum API keys reached - Delete unused keys
- **415025**: API key not found - Verify key exists
- **415028**: Enterprise account required - Contact support
- **415904**: Unauthorized request - Check your API key and Authorization header
- **415905**: Insufficient permissions - Contact account manager to verify account permissions

### Validation

- **415054**: Invalid sort field - Check sort parameter
- **415901**: Invalid request format - Check JSON syntax and request body
- **415902**: Item not found - Verify resource ID
- **415903**: Request cannot be processed - Check request parameters
- **415906**: Invalid request - Validate request format

### User Issues

- **415008**: Recipient address not active - Retry later
- **415009**: Recipient address inactive - Contact recipient
- **415010**: User deleted or banned - User must contact support
- **415034**: User insufficient balance - User must add funds
- **415059**: Recipient not found - Verify recipient information
- **415060**: Recipient cannot receive payouts - Contact recipient
- **415061**: Recipient from restricted territory - Use different recipient
- **415062**: Invalid recipient payment method - Recipient must reconfigure
- **415064**: Invalid recipient payment method - Recipient must reconfigure
- **415065**: User has violated the AML policy

### Payout Issues

- **415005**: Payout not found - Verify payout ID
- **415005**: Payout not found - Verify payout ID
- **415016**: Insufficient balance for payout - Add funds to wallet
- **415027**: Payout already processed - Check payout status
- **415035**: Payout amount too small - Increase payout amount
- **415055**: Cannot cancel non-pending payout - Check payout status
- **415056**: Payout code already exists - Use unique code
- **415057**: Payout exceeds maximum limit - Reduce payout amount
- **415058**: Payout below minimum limit - Increase payout amount
- **415073**: The payment provider could not deliver the funds to the user's payment method

### Payin Issues

- **415029**: Payin code already exists - Use unique code
- **415030**: Cannot confirm or cancel payin - Check payin status
- **415031**: Payin not found - Verify payin ID
- **415032**: Payin already completed - Check payin status
- **415053**: US users cannot make payins - Use alternative payment method

### Bulk Operations

- **415011**: Invalid file upload - Check file format and resubmit
- **415012**: Duplicate payouts detected - Remove duplicates
- **415013**: Bulk payout not in pending status - Check payout status
- **415014**: Insufficient balance - Add funds to wallet
- **415015**: Daily limit exceeded ($250,000) - Wait for next day or contact support
- **415017**: Cannot reject bulk payout - Check if already in progress
- **415019**: Bulk payout not finished - Wait for completion
- **415041**: Bulk payout not found - Verify bulk payout ID

### Account Management

- **415022**: Must empty balance before account deletion - Withdraw all funds
- **415045**: Deposit account type exists - Use different account type
- **415047**: Insufficient balance for withdrawal - Check currency balance

### Payment Infrastructure

- **415003**: Error reaching external service - Contact account manager
- **415036**: No active payment provider - Contact account manager
- **415046**: Country not supported - Contact account manager
- **415048**: Invalid payment rail - Verify account configuration
- **415049**: Bridge account not found - Contact account manager
- **415050**: Invalid crypto payment rail - Use Ethereum or Stellar
- **415051**: Crypto wallet not found - Contact account manager

### Reports & Operations

- **415039**: Operation not found - Verify operation ID
- **415042**: Statement not found - Verify statement ID
- **415043**: Statement not pending - Check statement status
- **415044**: Statement not completed - Wait for completion

### System Errors

- **415998**: Unexpected error - Contact account manager
- **415999**: Unknown error - Contact account manager

## Quick Troubleshooting

**Before contacting support:**

1. Check your API credentials and permissions
2. Verify request format and required fields
3. Confirm sufficient account balance
4. Review user/recipient account status
5. Check for duplicate codes or IDs

**When contacting support:**

- Include the specific error code
- Provide request details and timestamps
- Include relevant IDs (payout, payin, user)
- Describe what you were trying to accomplish


---

# Frequently Asked Questions

## API Credentials

### Generating API Credentials (API Key & Secret)

1. Log in to your Airtm Enterprise account
2. Go to: **Settings → API Keys**
3. Click **Generate New API Key**
4. Save both the **API Key** and **Secret Key** securely

> ⚠️ **Important**: Credentials are displayed only once—store them securely.

### Key Considerations

- **One credential per account**: Only one API credential can be generated per Enterprise account
- **Role requirements**: Only users with Owner or Admin roles can access this feature
- **Environment separation**: Use different keys for sandbox and production
- **Security**: Never expose keys in client-side code or public repositories

---

## Getting Started with the API

### Scope of the Airtm API

✅ **The Airtm API enables:**

- **Payouts**: Send money to recipients worldwide through their Airtm accounts
- **Payins**: Collect payments from users globally
- **Bulk Payouts**: Process multiple payouts efficiently in batches
- **User Verification**: Check recipient account status before sending payments
- **Account Management**: Monitor balances and account information
- **Reports**: Generate transaction data and audit reports
- **Withdrawals**: Transfer funds to external bank or crypto accounts
- **Deposits**: Track incoming funds to your enterprise account

❌ **Not supported:**

- P2P functionality between regular users
- Card operations or card-based payments
- Direct bank account creation for users
- Real-time currency trading

### Supported Regions

🌍 Airtm operates globally in 190+ countries, but certain jurisdictions are restricted due to regulatory requirements.
→ [Check the list of unsupported regions](https://help.airtm.com/en/support/solutions/articles/47001177565-where-are-airtm-s-products-and-services-available-)

### iFrames & Embedded Pages

🚫 Embedding Airtm pages via iframes is not supported due to security policies and authentication requirements.

### Rate Limits

- **Standard Rate Limit**: 10 requests per second per API key
- **Response**: HTTP 429 when exceeded
- **Best Practice**: Implement exponential backoff for retries
- **Higher Limits**: Contact support for increased limits if needed

### Currency & Payment Methods

- **Primary Currency**: All API operations are denominated in USD (USDC)
- **Currency conversion**: Handled automatically by the platform when needed
- **Supported transactions**: Between Airtm accounts and to external destinations
- **Fee structure**: Transparent fee calculation for all operations

---

## API Environments

### Sandbox (Testing) Environment

| **Parameter**        | **Value**                                                          |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Base URL**         | `https://api.stg.enterprise.airtm.com`                             |
| **Enterprise Login** | [Sandbox Portal](https://enterprise.stg.airtm.io)                  |
| **Documentation**    | [Sandbox Documentation](https://api.stg.enterprise.airtm.com/docs) |

#### Available Operations:

- **Payouts**: `/payouts` - Send money to recipients
- **Payins**: `/payins` - Collect payments from users
- **Bulk Payouts**: `/bulk-payouts` - Process multiple payouts
- **Users**: `/users` - Verify recipient accounts
- **Reports**: `/reports` - Generate transaction and activity reports
- **Withdrawals**: `/withdrawals` - Transfer to external accounts

#### Test Accounts:

- Create test accounts manually for comprehensive testing
- Request test funds from your assigned Airtm manager
- At least two accounts needed for complete transaction testing

### Production Environment

| **Parameter**        | **Value**                                                         |
| -------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Base URL**         | `https://api.enterprise.airtm.com`                                |
| **Enterprise Login** | [Live Portal](https://enterprise.airtm.com)                       |
| **Documentation**    | [Production Documentation](https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/docs) |

> ⚠️ **Important**: Always test thoroughly in sandbox before using production.

---

## Webhooks & Notifications

Configure webhook URLs to receive real-time notifications when transaction statuses change.

### Supported Operations

Webhooks are available for:

- **Payouts**: Status updates from creation to completion
- **Payins**: Payment processing notifications
- **Bulk Payouts**: Batch processing status updates

### Webhook Security

**IP Whitelisting** - Whitelist these IPs to receive webhooks:

🔒 → [Current server IPs are listed here](#description/ip-addresses)

### Webhook Management

- **Svix Integration**: Enhanced webhook delivery and management
- **Portal Access**: Configure webhooks through application portal
- **Signature Verification**: Validate webhook authenticity
- **Retry Logic**: Automatic retries for failed deliveries

### Example: Payout Webhook Payload

```json
{
  "id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "bulkPayoutId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "hash": "string",
  "code": "string",
  "airtmUserId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "airtmUserEmail": "string",
  "requireIdVerified": false,
  "notes": "string",
  "internalNote": "string",
  "status": "COMPLETED",
  "grossAmount": 10,
  "amount": 9.5,
  "netAmount": 9,
  "airtmFee": 0.5,
  "enterpriseFee": 0.5,
  "reasonCode": 522443,
  "reasonDescription": "string",
  "createdAt": "2025-08-20T17:01:44.634Z",
  "updatedAt": "2025-08-20T17:01:44.634Z"
}
```

### Example Payin Webhook Payload

```json
{
  "id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "code": "string",
  "hash": "string",
  "status": "CREATED",
  "amount": 10,
  "netAmount": 9.5,
  "airtmFee": 0.5,
  "description": "string",
  "items": [
    {
      "description": "string",
      "amount": 10,
      "quantity": 1,
      "id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
      "payinId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"
    }
  ],
  "airtmUserId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "airtmUserEmail": "hello@example.com",
  "failureReason": "string",
  "createdAt": "2025-08-20T17:01:44.634Z",
  "updatedAt": "2025-08-20T17:01:44.634Z",
  "confirmationUri": "string",
  "cancelUri": "string",
  "callbackUri": "string",
  "failureUri": "string"
}
```

### 🔐 Webhook Best Practices

- Return **2xx HTTP status code** to acknowledge receipt
- Implement **signature verification** for security
- Use **HTTPS** for all webhook URLs
- Handle **idempotency** to prevent duplicate processing
- Implement **retry logic** for temporary failures

---

## Transaction Statuses

### Payout Statuses

| **Status**  | **Final?** | **Description**                                                     |
| ----------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `CREATED`   | No         | Payout created, awaiting commit                                     |
| `COMMITTED` | No         | Payout committed and being processed                                |
| `PENDING`   | No         | Awaiting recipient action (account creation, ID verification, etc.) |
| `COMPLETED` | Yes        | Successfully delivered to recipient                                 |
| `CANCELED`  | Yes        | Cancelled by enterprise or system                                   |
| `FAILED`    | Yes        | Processing failed - contact support                                 |

### Payin Statuses

| **Status**   | **Final?** | **Description**                                |
| ------------ | ---------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| `CREATED`    | No         | Payment request created, awaiting user action  |
| `CONFIRMED`  | Yes        | Payment successfully processed                 |
| `CANCELED`   | Yes        | User cancelled the payment                     |
| `PROCESSING` | No         | User initiated payment, processing in progress |
| `FAILED`     | Yes        | Payment processing failed                      |

### Bulk Payout Statuses

| **Status**    | **Description**                               |
| ------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| `PENDING`     | Bulk payout received, validation in progress  |
| `IN_PROGRESS` | Individual payouts being processed            |
| `COMPLETED`   | All payouts processed (some may have failed)  |
| `REJECTED`    | Bulk payout rejected due to validation errors |

> 💡 **Tip**: Use case-insensitive comparisons when evaluating status strings.

---

## API Operations

### Core Endpoints

- **Account**: `GET /me` - Get account information and balance
- **Payouts**: Comprehensive payout management with two-step process
- **Payins**: Payment collection with hosted checkout
- **Users**: `GET /users?email={email}` - Verify recipients before payouts
- **Reports**: Generate and download transaction data
- **Bulk Payouts**: Process multiple payouts efficiently

**User statuses :**

- `ACTIVE` - ✅ Can receive payments
- `INACTIVE` - ❌ Account deactivated

---

## Transaction Fees, Limits & Processing Times

### Fees & Limits

| **Parameter**                  | **Value**                              |
| ------------------------------ | -------------------------------------- |
| **Minimum (US & Puerto Rico)** | $1 USDC                                |
| **Minimum (Other regions)**    | $0.01 USDC                             |
| **Maximum per transaction**    | No upper limit                         |
| **Fees**                       | Contact the sales team for exact rates |

### Processing Times

- **Payouts to existing verified users**: Up to 2 minutes
- **Payouts to new users**: Up to 90 days (pending account creation)
- **Payins**: Immediate after user confirmation
- **Bulk payouts**: Depends on batch size, typically 15-30 minutes
- **Reports**: 5-15 minutes depending on data volume
- **Withdrawals**: 1-3 business days depending on destination

### Expiration Rules

- **Payins**: Expire after **15 days**
- **Payouts to unregistered users**: **90 days** (configurable in dashboard)
- **Report download URLs**: **1 hour**

---

## Security & Authentication

### Authentication Methods

**HTTP Basic Authentication** is required for all requests:

```text
Authorization: Basic <base64-encoded-credentials>
```

### Setting Up Authentication

1. **Combine credentials**: `api_key:secret_key`
2. **Base64 encode**: Use any base64 encoder
3. **Add header**: `Authorization: Basic <encoded_credentials>`

### Code Examples

**cURL:**

```bash
curl -X GET "https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/me" \
  -u "your_api_key:your_secret_key"
```

**JavaScript:**

```javascript
const auth = btoa('your_api_key:your_secret_key');
const response = await fetch('https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/me', {
  headers: { Authorization: `Basic ${auth}` },
});
```

**Python:**

```python
import requests
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

response = requests.get(
    'https://api.enterprise.airtm.com/me',
    auth=HTTPBasicAuth('your_api_key', 'your_secret_key')
)
```

### Security Best Practices

- **Store credentials securely** using environment variables
- **Use HTTPS** for all requests
- **Separate environments** with different API keys
- **Rotate credentials** regularly (every 90 days recommended)
- **Monitor API usage** for unusual patterns
- **Never expose keys** in client-side code

---

> 📞 **Need Help?** Contact [enterprise@airtm.com](mailto:enterprise@airtm.com) for support with API integration, technical issues, or account questions.


---

# Changelog

Stay up-to-date with the latest improvements, new features, and important changes to the Enterprise API. We continuously enhance our platform to provide you with better functionality and reliability.

## 🚀 What's New

### V2 API Beta (June 2025)

**Major Release**: We've launched our next-generation API with enhanced capabilities and improved developer experience.

#### Supported Features:

- **Bulk Operations**: Process multiple payouts simultaneously
- **Enhanced Payouts**: Improved error handling and status tracking
- **User Management**: Retrieve user details and manage balances
- **Advanced Reporting**: Generate detailed reports with timezone support
- **Better Authentication**: Streamlined API authentication and error responses

---

## 📋 Recent Updates

### August 2025

#### 🔧 Major Improvements

- **Webhook Management**: Introduced webhook application portal
- **Advanced User Search**: Added support for searching users by hash for improved user discovery

#### ✨ New Features

- **API Withdrawals**: New enterprise withdrawal endpoints for better fund management
- **External Account Management**: Complete CRUD operations for both bank and crypto external accounts
- **ID Verification Controls**: Added enterprise-level settings to require ID verification for payouts
- **Bulk Operations**: Improved bulk payout processing with better status tracking

### July 2025

#### 🔧 Improvements

- **Webhook Infrastructure**: Migrated to Svix for more reliable webhook delivery and management
- **Search Capabilities**: Enhanced payout search functionality using notes field

#### ✨ New Features

- **Payin Events**: Added Svix events for payin creation and cancellation
- **Enhanced Validation**: Added state validation for US users in requests

#### 🔧 Bug Fixes

- **Metadata Handling**: Improved metadata merging to prevent data overwriting
- **Report Security**: Better audit trail tracking for statement downloads with correct user identification
- **Email Processing**: Added automatic email trimming for improved data quality
- **Payout Status**: Fixed bulk payouts stuck in progress status
- **Bridge Transactions**: Resolved missing transactions in activity reports
- **Webhook Delivery**: Improved webhook callback event publishing

### June 2025

#### 🔧 Improvements

- Enhanced withdrawal processing with better status tracking
- Improved validation for external accounts and currency handling
- Better handling of cancellation URLs
- Enhanced report validation and CSV formatting

#### ✨ New Features

- Added support for payout codes and unique identifiers
- Automatic cancellation of payouts when users are disabled
- Custom cancellation URLs for better user experience

### May 2025

#### 🔧 Critical Fixes

- Fixed timezone handling in reports
- Improved webhook monitoring and reliability
- Enhanced error reporting with detailed reason codes
- Better handling of pending payouts

#### ✨ New Features

- Timezone support added to all reporting features
- Automatic refund system for failed completed payouts
- Enhanced recipient validation with comprehensive checks

#### ⚠️ Breaking Changes

- **V0.3.0**: Enhanced recipient validation now performs comprehensive checks when creating and committing payouts. This may affect existing integrations that don't provide complete recipient information.

### April 2025

#### 🔧 Improvements

- Expanded payout eligibility for additional US users
- Improved pending status handling across different payout types
- Enhanced user verification checks during processing
- Better retry mechanisms for failed payouts

#### ✨ New Features

- Automatic retry of pending payouts when users complete required actions
- Configurable timeout settings for pending payout cancellation
- Support for payouts to third-party users

#### ⚠️ Breaking Changes

- **V0.2.0**: Payout status flow has been standardized. All payouts now use a consistent two-step process with `CREATED` and `COMMITTED` statuses having updated meanings. This affects how you should handle payout state transitions.

### March 2025

#### 🔧 Improvements

- Enhanced direct withdrawal functionality
- Fixed audit report generation issues
- Improved pending balance calculations
- Better payment descriptions using available memos

#### ✨ New Features

- PDF generation for audit reports
- Automatic retry system for volume-limited payouts
- Custom aliases support for crypto withdrawals

---

## 🗃️ Archive

<details>
<summary>Show Codes</summary>

**February 2025**

- Enhanced security measures
- Improved error handling across all endpoints
- Performance optimizations for large-scale operations

**January 2025**

- Infrastructure improvements
- Enhanced monitoring capabilities
- Bug fixes and stability improvements

**2024 Highlights**

- Integration with third-party liquidity providers
- Core payout functionality
- Basic reporting features

_For detailed information about changes prior to 2025, please contact our support team._

</details>

---

## 🔔 Stay Informed

- **Breaking Changes**: Always marked with ⚠️ and include migration guidance
- **Security Updates**: Critical security fixes are released immediately
- **API Versioning**: We maintain backward compatibility whenever possible

For technical support or questions about any changes, please reach out to our [support team](mailto:enterprise@airtm.com).

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a payout instruction. In the request body, information about
the payout such as the recipient's email, description, amount, and any URLs needed for confirmation
or failure redirects should be provided.

Upon successful creation, the API returns a response containing the details of the newly created
payout, including a unique ID.

> [!tip]
> After making a call to this endpoint, no money is moved yet. To finish moving the money to a
> user, you must call the `POST /v2/payouts/:id/commit` endpoint with the id from this response.
> Alternatively, you may pass `commit: true` to do the payout in a single API call.

delete.description:
This endpoint allows users to cancel specific `CREATED` or `PENDING` individual payouts—those that:

- have been created and committed but where the recipient is not ready to receive the payout.
- have been created but have not yet been committed.

Pending payouts will automatically cancel after 90 days (by default, other time periods are
available in dashboard settings) from the creation date.

Once canceled:

- Funds are automatically returned to the enterprise's balance.
- The individual payout status is updated to `CANCELED`.
- The response will include all relevant details of the canceled payout.

Additional information about canceled payouts can be accessed through the [Enterprise Portal](enterprise.airtm.com)

post.description:
Create a new bulk payout. You will receive a response with the id of your bulk payout, and the
processing will start asynchronously after you receive your response.

You can check in with the progress of your ongoing bulk payout by using the `GET /bulk-payouts/{id}` endpoint.

If you want to cancel payouts, use the [Cancel Payout](#tag/payouts/DELETE/payouts/{id}) endpoint.

get.description:
Endpoint to retrieve the details of an existing bulk payout. The status `RUNNING` is the default
after you have posted your bulk payout. It means that the individual payouts are being
processed and not all of them have been processed yet. Once that has happened, the status will
switch to `DONE`.

To list all payouts associated with a specific bulk payout, use the [List Payouts](#tag/payouts/GET/payouts)
endpoint and pass the bulk payout id as the `bulkPayoutId` query parameter.

tags.name: Payouts
tags.description:
# Payouts

Send money to recipients worldwide through their Airtm accounts. Payouts use a secure two-step process to prevent accidental payments.

## How Payouts Work

### Two-Step Process

1. **Create** - Validates recipient and reserves funds
2. **Commit** - Actually sends the money

This prevents accidental payments and allows for approval workflows.

### One-Step Option

Set `commit: true` when creating to skip the manual commit step for automated workflows.

## Integration Workflows

### Standard Two-Step

Create payout → Review details → Commit when approved

### Automated Processing

Create with `commit: true` for immediate processing

tags.name: Bulk Payouts
tags.description:
# Bulk Payouts

Process multiple payouts efficiently in a single batch operation. Ideal for payroll, affiliate payments, or mass distributions.

## Overview

Bulk payouts allow you to submit hundreds or thousands of payout instructions and process them as a coordinated batch, providing better performance and easier management than individual payouts.

## How It Works

1. **Prepare** your payout data with recipient emails and amounts
2. **Submit** the bulk payout request
3. **Validation** - System validates all payouts and checks balance
4. **Processing** - Individual payouts are processed in parallel
5. **Track** progress and handle any failures

## Validation Rules

### Amount Validation

- Minimum amount: $0.01. If the recipient is a US resident, the minimum amount may be larger.
- Maximum 2 decimal places allowed
- Enterprise fee cannot equal or exceed payout amount (unless negative for bonuses)
- Airtm fee cannot equal or exceed net amount (amount - enterprise fee)

### Data Validation

- Email addresses must be valid format and correspond to active Airtm accounts
- Notes field is required and cannot exceed 255 characters
- No malicious patterns allowed in text fields (SQL injection protection)
- URLs must be valid format when provided

### Batch Validation

- No duplicate payouts within batch (based on email + amount + notes)
- Total batch amount cannot exceed available account balance

tags.name: Payins
tags.description:
# Payins

The Payins API enables you to collect payments from users worldwide through their Airtm accounts. This is ideal for e-commerce platforms, service providers, and any business that needs to accept payments from customers across different countries and currencies.

## Overview

Payins allow you to create payment requests that customers can fulfill using their Airtm account balance or connected payment methods. The system handles currency conversion, fee calculation, and provides a seamless checkout experience for your users.

## Key Features

- **Global Payment Collection**: Accept payments from users in 190+ countries
- **Multiple Payment Methods**: Users can pay with Airtm balance, bank transfers, or connected payment sources
- **Itemized Billing**: Support for multiple items with quantities and individual pricing
- **Automatic Currency Conversion**: Handle multiple currencies seamlessly
- **Secure Checkout**: Hosted payment pages with built-in security
- **Real-time Status Updates**: Track payment progress with webhooks and status polling
- **Mobile Optimized**: Responsive design works across all devices

## How Payins Work

### Payment Flow

1. **Create Payment Request**: Generate a payin with item details and amounts
2. **Redirect Customer**: Send customer to Airtm's secure checkout page
3. **Customer Authentication**: User logs into their Airtm account
4. **Payment Processing**: Customer completes payment using available methods
5. **Confirmation**: Receive real-time notification of payment status
6. **Fulfillment**: Deliver goods or services upon successful payment

### Checkout Experience

Customers are redirected to a secure Airtm-hosted checkout page where they can:

- Review itemized billing and total amounts
- Select their preferred payment method
- Complete the transaction securely
- Receive confirmation and receipts

## Checkout Integration

### Redirect URL Structure

The checkout URL follows the pattern: `{baseUrl}/checkout/{id}`

Where:

- `baseUrl` is your environment's base URL
- `id` is the payin identifier returned from creation

### Mobile Considerations

For mobile applications, configure redirection links to open in the device's default browser rather than in-app web views. This ensures proper authentication flow and better user experience.

### Callback URLs

Configure callback URLs to handle different payment outcomes:

- **Confirmation URL**: Where customers are redirected after successful payment
- **Failure URL**: Where customers go if payment fails
- **Cancel URL**: Where customers are sent if they cancel the payment

## Item Management

### Itemized Billing

Payins support detailed itemization with:

- Individual item descriptions
- Quantity and unit pricing

tags.name: Me
tags.description:
# Account Management

The Account Management API provides essential information about your Airtm Enterprise account, including account details, balance information, and configuration settings. This endpoint serves as your primary source for account status and financial data.

## Overview

Account management functionality enables you to monitor your enterprise account status, check available balances, and access important configuration details needed for payment processing. This information is crucial for managing cash flow, monitoring transaction capacity, and ensuring smooth payment operations.

## Key Features

- **Account Information**: Access enterprise account details and settings
- **Balance Monitoring**: Real-time balance information
- **Configuration Access**: Retrieve account settings and limits
- **Administrative Data**: Access enterprise-specific configuration details

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
# Users

The Users API provides essential user management capabilities for your Airtm Enterprise integration. This endpoint allows you to verify recipient information, check account status, and ensure successful payout delivery before initiating transactions.

## Overview

User verification is a critical step in the payout process that helps prevent failed transactions, reduces processing delays, and improves overall payment success rates. The API provides comprehensive user information including account status, verification level, and eligibility for receiving payments.

## Key Features

- **User Verification**: Validate recipient accounts before creating payouts
- **Status Checking**: Determine if users can receive payments
- **Account Details**: Access user profile information and verification status
- **Eligibility Validation**: Confirm compliance and geographic restrictions
- **Real-time Data**: Get current user status and account information

## Why Verify Users

### Prevent Failed Payouts

Verifying users before creating payouts helps identify potential issues early:

- Inactive or suspended accounts
- Unverified users who cannot receive payments
- Geographic restrictions or compliance issues
- Account limitations or restrictions

### Improve Success Rates

Pre-verification significantly improves payout success rates by:

- Ensuring recipients can actually receive payments
- Identifying verification requirements in advance
- Confirming account status before reserving funds
- Reducing processing delays and failures

### Better User Experience

User verification enables better customer service:

- Provide clear error messages for invalid recipients
- Guide users through account setup requirements
- Offer alternative solutions for ineligible recipients
- Reduce failed payment frustrations

tags.name: Deposits
tags.description:
# Deposits

The Deposits API provides comprehensive tracking and management of funding transactions for your Airtm Enterprise account. This endpoint enables you to monitor incoming funds, track deposit history, and manage your account's funding sources for seamless payment operations.

## Overview

Deposits represent incoming funds to your enterprise account from various sources including bank transfers, wire transfers, and other funding methods. The API provides detailed tracking of these transactions, enabling better cash flow management and financial reconciliation.

## Key Features

- **Transaction Tracking**: Monitor all incoming fund deposits with detailed status information
- **Multi-Source Support**: Track deposits from various funding sources and payment methods
- **Real-time Status**: Get current deposit status and processing information
- **Historical Data**: Access complete deposit history with filtering and pagination
- **Metadata Access**: Retrieve detailed transaction information and processing details
- **Balance Integration**: Understand how deposits affect your account balance

## How Deposits Work

### Funding Process

1. **Initiate Funding**: Start a deposit through your preferred funding method
2. **Processing**: External payment systems process the incoming transfer
3. **Tracking**: Monitor deposit status through the API
4. **Completion**: Funds become available in your enterprise account
5. **Notification**: Receive confirmation of successful deposit
6. **Balance Update**: Account balance reflects the new funds

### Deposit Sources

Deposits can originate from various sources:

- Bank wire transfers
- ACH transfers
- International bank transfers
- Partner funding arrangements

tags.name: Reports
tags.description:
# Reports

Generate detailed financial reports for your Airtm Enterprise account. Reports provide transaction data, audit trails, and downloadable CSV files for accounting and compliance.

## How Reports Work

Reports are generated asynchronously to handle large datasets efficiently:

1. **Create** - Submit report request for specific month/year
2. **Monitor** - Check status until completed
3. **Download** - Get secure CSV file when ready

## Report Types

### Transaction Reports

Complete transaction data including all payouts and payins with amounts, fees, recipients, and status information.

### Audit Reports

Comprehensive audit trails including account balance changes, administrative actions, and system events.

## Core Operations

### Create Report

Generate a new report for a specific month and year. Reports are processed asynchronously.

### List Reports

Get paginated list of your reports with filtering by type and status.

### Get Report Details

Retrieve information about a specific report including generation status and metadata.

### Download Report File

Get secure download URL for completed reports. URLs expire after 1 hour for security.

## Report Statuses

| Status       | Description        | Next Steps          |
| ------------ | ------------------ | ------------------- |
| `PENDING`    | Report queued      | Wait for processing |
| `PROCESSING` | Being generated    | Monitor status      |
| `COMPLETED`  | Ready for download | Download file       |
| `FAILED`     | Generation failed  | Check error, retry  |

## Report Contents

### CSV Format

Reports include comprehensive data with columns for transaction IDs, types, statuses, amounts, fees, recipients, and timestamps.

### Data Scope

- All transactions for the specified month
- Complete fee breakdowns
- Currency conversion details
- Compliance and regulatory information

## Best Practices

- Generate reports during off-peak hours when possible
- Use monthly ranges for better performance
- Download reports immediately after completion
- Implement proper retry logic for failed generations
- Store downloaded reports securely

## Common Issues

**Report Stuck in Pending**

- Check for high system load
- Contact support if stuck over 30 minutes

**Empty Reports**

- Verify transactions exist for the date range
- Check timezone settings

**Download URL Expired**

- Generate new download URL
- URLs expire after 1 hour

## Error Handling

- **Report Not Found (415042)**: Check report ID
- **Report Not Completed (415044)**: Wait for processing to finish
- **Invalid Parameters (415054)**: Verify month/year values

For complete error reference, see [Reason Codes](#description/reason-codes).

## Getting Started

1. Set up [authentication](#description/authentication)
2. Test report generation in sandbox
3. Implement status monitoring
4. Set up secure file download

## Related Resources

- [Payouts](#tag/payouts) - Transaction data included in reports
- [Account Management](#tag/me) - Check account details
- [Error Codes](#description/reason-codes) - Troubleshoot issues

tags.name: External Bank Account
tags.description:
# External Bank Account

The external bank account API provides the capability to register an external bank account where you can withdraw your funds to.

tags.name: External Crypto Account
tags.description:
# External Crypto Account

The external crypto account API provides the capability to register an external crypto account where you can withdraw your funds to.

tags.name: Withdrawals
tags.description:
# Withdrawals

The withdrawals API provides the capability to withdraw your funds to a previously registered external account (Bank or Crypto)

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks are how services notify each other of events.

At their core they are just a POST request to a pre-determined endpoint.
The endpoint can be whatever you want, and you can just add them from the UI.
You normally use one endpoint per service, and that endpoint listens to all of the event types.

For example, if you receive webhooks from Airtm, you can structure your URL like: `https://www.example.com/webhooks/airtm`.

The way to indicate that a webhook has been processed is by returning a 2xx (status code 200-299) response to the webhook message within a reasonable time-frame (15s).

It's also important to disable CSRF protection for this endpoint if the framework you use enables them by default.

Another important aspect of handling webhooks is to verify the signature and timestamp when processing them.

You can learn more about it in the signature verification section.

# Adding an Endpoint

In order to start listening to messages, you will need to configure your endpoints.

Adding an endpoint is as simple as providing a URL that you control and selecting the event types that you want to listen to. You can do this by navigating to the "Webhooks" section in the [enterprise dashboard](https://enterprise.airtm.com/settings/webhooks).

If you don't specify any event types, by default, your endpoint will receive all events, regardless of type.

This can be helpful for getting started and for testing, but we recommend changing this to a subset later on to avoid receiving extraneous messages.

If your endpoint isn't quite ready to start receiving events, you can press the "with Svix Play" button to have a unique URL generated for you.

You'll be able to view and inspect webhooks sent to your Svix Play URL, making it effortless to get started.

# Testing Endpoints

Once you've added an endpoint, you'll want to make sure its working.

The "Testing" tab lets you send test events to your endpoint.

After sending an example event, you can click into the message to view the message payload, all of the message attempts, and whether it succeeded or failed.

# Verifying Signatures

Webhook signatures let you verify that webhook messages are actually sent by us and not a malicious actor.

For a more detailed explanation, check out this article on [why you should verify webhooks](https://docs.svix.com/receiving/verifying-payloads/why).

Our webhook partner Svix offers a set of useful libraries that make verifying webhooks very simple. Here is a an example using Javascript:

```javascript
import { Webhook } from 'svix';

const secret = 'whsec_MfKQ9r8GKYqrTwjUPD8ILPZIo2LaLaSw';

// These were all sent from the server
const headers = {
  'svix-id': 'msg_p5jXN8AQM9LWM0D4loKWxJek',
  'svix-timestamp': '1614265330',
  'svix-signature': 'v1,g0hM9SsE+OTPJTGt/tmIKtSyZlE3uFJELVlNIOLJ1OE=',
};
const payload = '{"test": 2432232314}';

const wh = new Webhook(secret);
// Throws on error, returns the verified content on success
const payload = wh.verify(payload, headers);
```

For more instructions and examples of how to verify signatures, check out their [webhook verification documentation](https://docs.svix.com/receiving/verifying-payloads/how).

# Retries

We attempt to deliver each webhook message based on a retry schedule with exponential backoff.

## The schedule

Each message is attempted based on the following schedule, where each period is started following the failure of the preceding attempt:

- Immediately
- 5 seconds
- 5 minutes
- 30 minutes
- 2 hours
- 5 hours
- 10 hours
- 10 hours (in addition to the previous)

If an endpoint is removed or disabled delivery attempts to the endpoint will be disabled as well.

For example, an attempt that fails three times before eventually succeeding will be delivered roughly 35 minutes and 5 seconds following the first attempt.

## Manual retries

You can also use the application portal to manually retry each message at any time, or automatically retry ("Recover") all failed messages starting from a given date.

# Troubleshooting Tips

There are some common reasons why your webhook endpoint is failing:

## Not using the raw payload body

This is the most common issue. When generating the signed content, we use the raw string body of the message payload.

If you convert JSON payloads into strings using methods like stringify, different implementations may produce different string representations of the JSON object, which can lead to discrepancies when verifying the signature. It's crucial to verify the payload exactly as it was sent, byte-for-byte or string-for-string, to ensure accurate verification.

## Missing the secret key

From time to time we see people simple using the wrong secret key. Remember that keys are unique to endpoints.

## Sending the wrong response codes

When we receive a response with a 2xx status code, we interpret that as a successful delivery even if you indicate a failure in the response payload. Make sure to use the right response status codes so we know when message are supposed to succeed vs fail.

## Responses timing out

We will consider any message that fails to send a response within 15 seconds a failed message. If your endpoint is also processing complicated workflows, it may timeout and result in failed messages.

We suggest having your endpoint simply receive the message and add it to a queue to be processed asynchronously so you can respond promptly and avoiding getting timed out.

# Failure Recovery

## Re-enable a disabled endpoint

If all attempts to a specific endpoint fail for a period of 5 days, the endpoint will be disabled. To re-enable a disabled endpoint, go to the webhook dashboard, find the endpoint from the list and select "Enable Endpoint".

## Recovering/Resending failed messages

If your service has downtime or if your endpoint was misconfigured, you probably want to recover any messages that failed during the downtime.

If you want to replay a single event, you can find the message from the UI and click the options menu next to any of the attempts.

From there, click "resend" to have the same message send to your endpoint again.

If you need to recover from a service outage and want to replay all the events since a given time, you can do so from the Endpoint page. On an endpoint's details page, click "Options > Recover Failed Messages".

From there, you can choose a time window to recover from.

For a more granular recovery - for example, if you know the exact timestamp that you want to recover from - you can click the options menu on any message from the endpoint page.

From there, you can click "Replay..." and choose to "Replay all failed messages since this time."

# IP Addresses

Webhooks are sent from the following IP addresses:

- `44.228.126.217`
- `50.112.21.217`
- `52.24.126.164`
- `54.148.139.208`
- `2600:1f24:64:8000::/56`
